1 /**
  2  * Builds one elevation grid chunk. It can consists of several elevation grids to be used in a LOD.
  3  * For every appearance in the appearances parameter one level is built with 25% size of the last level.
  4  * @param parentNode - Dom element to append the elevation grids to.
  5  * @param info - Information about the ID,position of the chunk, the heightmap's size and the modelIndex.
  6  * @param hf - The heightmap to be used for the elevation grid.
  7  * @param appearances - Array of appearances. For every appearance one level for LOD is built. 1 Level = no LOD.
  8  * @constructor
  9  */
 10 function ElevationGrid(parentNode,info, hf,appearances)
 11 {
 12     "use strict";
 13 
 14     /**
 15      * Creates and inserts elevation grid (terrain chunk) into DOM.
 16      */
 17     function setupChunk()
 18     {
 19 
 20         try
 21         {
 22             var elevationGrid, shape, shf;
 23 
 24             //We build one level of a LOD for every appearance. Example: With 3 children means: [Full Resolution, 1/2 Resolution, 1/4 Resolution]
 25             for(var i=0; i<appearances.length; i++)
 26             {
 27                 //All none full resolutions needs to be one element bigger to keep the desired length
 28                 var add = 0;
 29                 if(i !== 0)
 30                 { add = 1;  }
 31 
 32                 //Set up: Shape-> Appearance -> ImageTexture +  Texturetransform
 33                 shape = document.createElement('Shape');
 34                 shape.setAttribute("id",info.modelIndex+"_shape_"+info.ID+"_"+i);
 35 
 36                 //Build the Elevation Grids
 37                 //shrink the heightfield to the correct size for this detail level
 38                 shf = shrinkHeightMap(hf, info.chunkWidth, info.chunkHeight,Math.pow(2,i));
 39                 elevationGrid = document.createElement('ElevationGrid');
 40                 elevationGrid.setAttribute("id", info.modelIndex+"hm"+ info.ID+"_"+i);
 41                 elevationGrid.setAttribute("solid", "false");
 42                 elevationGrid.setAttribute("xSpacing", String(Math.pow(2,i)));//To keep the same size with fewer elements increase the space of one element
 43                 elevationGrid.setAttribute("zSpacing", String(Math.pow(2,i)));
 44                 elevationGrid.setAttribute("xDimension", String(info.chunkWidth/Math.pow(2,i)+add));//fewer elements in every step
 45                 elevationGrid.setAttribute("zDimension", String(info.chunkHeight/Math.pow(2,i)+add));
 46                 elevationGrid.setAttribute("height", shf );
 47                 elevationGrid.appendChild(calcTexCoords(info.xpos, info.ypos, info.chunkWidth, info.chunkHeight, info.terrainWidth, info.terrainHeight,Math.pow(2,i)));
 48 
 49                 shape.appendChild(appearances[i]);
 50                 shape.appendChild(elevationGrid);
 51 
 52                 parentNode.appendChild(shape);
 53 
 54                 //set vars null
 55                 shf = null;
 56                 shape = null;
 57                 elevationGrid = null;
 58             }
 59             hf = null;
 60             parentNode = null;
 61             info = null;
 62             appearances = null;
 63         }
 64         catch(error)
 65         {
 66             alert('ElevationGrid::setupChunk(): ' + error);
 67         }
 68     }
 69 
 70     /**
 71      * Shrinks the heightfield with the given factor
 72      * @param heightfield - The used heihgfield.
 73      * @param sizex - Width of the heightfield.
 74      * @param sizey - Height of the heightfield.
 75      * @param shrinkfactor - Factor to shrink the heightmap. 1:Full heightmap 2: 25% (scaled 50% on each side)
 76      * @returns {string}
 77      */
 78     function shrinkHeightMap(heightfield, sizex, sizey, shrinkfactor)
 79     {
 80         var smallGrid, smallx, smally, val,i,k,l,o,div;
 81 
 82         smallGrid = [];
 83         smallx = parseInt(sizex/shrinkfactor);
 84         smally = parseInt(sizey/shrinkfactor);
 85         //IF shrunk, the heightfield needs one more element than the desired length (63 elements for a length of 62)
 86         if( shrinkfactor !== 1)
 87         {
 88             smallx++;
 89             smally++;
 90             div=shrinkfactor*shrinkfactor;
 91 
 92             for(i=0; i<smally; i++)
 93             {
 94                 var i_sf = (i*shrinkfactor);
 95 
 96                 for(k=0; k<smallx; k++)
 97                 {
 98                     var k_sf = (k*shrinkfactor);
 99                     val = 0;
100                     for(l=0; l<shrinkfactor; l++)
101                     {
102                         for(o=0; o<shrinkfactor; o++)
103                         {
104                             var x = k_sf + l;
105                             var y = i_sf + o;
106                             if(x >= sizex) x = sizex -1;
107                             if(y >= sizey) y = sizey -1;
108                             var tmp = heightfield[y][x];
109                             val = val + parseFloat(tmp);
110                         }
111                     }
112                     val = val/div;
113                     smallGrid.push(val+ " ");
114                 }
115             }
116         }
117         else
118         {
119             for(i=0; i<smally; i++)
120             {
121                 for(k=0; k<smallx; k++)
122                 {
123                     val = parseFloat( heightfield[i][k]);
124                     smallGrid.push(val+" ");
125                 }
126             }
127         }
128         return smallGrid.join(" ");
129     }
130 
131     /**
132      * Calcs the TextureCoordinates for the elevation grid(s).
133      * Use the values of the full/most detailed version if using for LOD and adjust only the shrinkfactor parameter.
134      * @param xpos - Start position of the elevation grid within the terrain.
135      * @param ypos - Start position of the elevation grid within the terrain.
136      * @param sizex - Size of the elevation grid on the x-Axis.
137      * @param sizey - Size of the elevation grid on the x-Axis.
138      * @param terrainWidth - Size of the whole terrain on the x-Axis.
139      * @param terrainHeight - Size of the whole terrain on the y-Axis.
140      * @param shrinkfactor - The factor the heightmap this TextureCoordinates are was shrunk.
141      * @returns {HTMLElement} - X3DOM TextureCoordinate Node.
142      */
143     function calcTexCoords(xpos,ypos,sizex,sizey,terrainWidth, terrainHeight, shrinkfactor)
144     {
145         var tc, tcnode,i,k, offsetx, offsety, partx, party, tmpx, tmpy,smallx,smally;
146         offsetx = xpos/terrainWidth;
147         offsety = ypos/terrainHeight;
148         partx   = parseFloat( (sizex/terrainWidth)*(1/sizex)*shrinkfactor );
149         party   = parseFloat( (sizey/terrainHeight)*(1/sizey)*shrinkfactor );
150         smallx = parseInt(sizex/shrinkfactor);
151         smally = parseInt(sizey/shrinkfactor);
152 
153         if( shrinkfactor !== 1)
154         {
155             smallx++;
156             smally++;
157         }
158 
159         var buffer = [];
160         //Create Node
161         tcnode = document.createElement("TextureCoordinate");
162 
163         //File string
164         for (i = 0; i < smally; i++)
165         {
166             for (k = 0; k < smallx; k++)
167             {
168                 tmpx = offsetx + (k*partx);
169                 tmpy = offsety + (i*party);
170 
171                 buffer.push(tmpx + " ");
172                 buffer.push(tmpy + " ");
173             }
174         }
175         tc = buffer.join("");
176 
177         tcnode.setAttribute("point", tc);
178 
179         return tcnode;
180     }
181 
182     setupChunk();
183 }
